impact-statement: Charybdotoxin, a toxin produced by scorpions, blocks a K<sup>+</sup> channel by binding in a lock-and-key fashion to the mouth of the channel and presenting a lysine amino group, which serves as a K<sup>+</sup> mimic in the selectivity filter.
